title: Can I purchase a vehicle while going through divorce?
question: No agreements have been made in writing. But The vehicle I was driving was in my wifes name and she wanted it back, now I need my own vehicle
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
Just to be clear, she wants both vehicles?
You really do need an atty to look out for your interests.

You really should be represented by counsel in your divorce proceeding. You should ask your lawyer about this. I think you should be able to buy a car. I would suggest that you use separate property funds for it, or she may decide she likes the new car better than the one you gave her. Just use funds that you had prior to the marriage if you segregated them. Or use money that you have earned by working since the date of separation, which should also be separate property. Use funds earned during the marriage (community property funds) to pay any community debts.
